bottle_data.name: Evan Williams Bottled in Bond White Label

name: Evan Williams Bottled in Bond White Label
reasoning: This is a fantastic value bourbon, bottled in bond, meaning it's a guaranteed 100 proof and aged at least 4 years. At around $32, it's very close to their current price range and a great starting point for exploring bourbon.
relationship: Complementary addition. This introduces a solid, affordable baseline bourbon to their collection.

name: Early Times Bottled In Bond
reasoning: Another excellent bottled-in-bond option at a very reasonable price (around $36).  It offers a slightly different flavor profile than the Evan Williams, allowing for some comparison and exploration.
relationship: Complementary addition.  Provides another benchmark budget bourbon for comparison.

name: 1792 Small Batch
reasoning: A small step up in price (around $45), this bourbon is well-regarded for its balanced flavor profile and smoothness. It's a good introduction to small-batch bourbons.
relationship: Complementary addition. Introduces a higher-quality small batch bourbon within a reasonable price range.

name: Wild Turkey 101
reasoning: A classic bourbon with a higher proof (50.5%) than the previous recommendations. It has a bold, spicy flavor that offers a distinct experience. It's also very affordable, usually under $40.
relationship: Complementary addition.  Expands the collection with a higher-proof, more robust flavor profile.

name: Four Roses Small Batch
reasoning: This is another step up in quality and complexity, coming in around $50.  Four Roses uses multiple recipes and yeast strains, resulting in a unique and flavorful bourbon.
relationship: Complementary addition.  Introduces a more complex and nuanced bourbon to their developing palate.
